page.title: 03FARMING.
page.content: The bulk of the land is used for{ arable farming, particularly growing{ malting barley. It is a rich greensand loam and produces heavy crops.The winter crop is sugar beet harvested between September and November, and driven by lorry to King's Lynn to be processed. Some small fields grow blackcurrants and strawberries as a contract crop for freezer firms. Most of the small farms have been merged into the larger businesses and where formerly thirty men might be employed now there may only be three. There are no cattle in the village and only occasionally sheep are found. Most of the former farm labourers are now employed in the nearby town of Fakenham.
